A vent is located in the TDI bulk storage room that would minimize the build-up of, TDI vapors and decrease the potential for release of vapors into other areas of the facility in the event of a small leak within the room. The TDI day tank room has an active exhaust that passes through a carbon scrubber before being vented out of the facility. Sensor systems were installed in the bulk storage and day tank storage that monitor TDI levels in the rooms. Remote displays allow employees to check for levels of TDI down to 1 part per billion (ppb) prior to entering the storage areas. If levels rise above 1 ppb, site alarms will activate, and site evacuation will occur. Our maintenance department has a preventative maintenance program that includes critical TDI safety and testing of equipment.

Master Builders Solutions Construction Systems in Brighton, Colorado was most recently known as BASF Construction Chemicals. It has the primary activity of producing adhesives and caulks for use in the construction industry. Toluene diisocyanate (TDI) is the regulated substance stored and used within the plant.

TDI is received in 45,000-pound tank trucks and transferred to a 64,000-pound holding tank within the building. The handling of TDI in the MBS process is controlled by a Distributed Control System (DCS). Prior to use in manufacturing, TDI is pumped from the bulk storage tank into one of four 2350-pound capacity day tanks. TDI is then pumped from the day tanks to mixer heads in the intermediate area, reacting and consuming the material. This activation procedure is controlled through a DCS which will shut down operations and sound an alarm if outside close tolerances.

MBS has specific standard operating procedures and training in the offloading of tankers to bulk storage. The TDI off-loading SOP specifies that a trained MBS employee wearing proper PPE will be present during the entire offload procedure, including transfer hose hookup, product transfer, offload and during removal of the transfer hose. Any leak or rupture will be observed, and proper steps taken to shut down transfer to minimize TDI loss. An isocyanate emergency stop is located at the offload station that automatically stops the offload operation when activated.

MBS has a comprehensive contingency (emergency response) plan that includes procedures for chemical spills/releases, medical emergencies, natural disasters, and environmental issues. Commitment to the Community:
Master Builders Solutions Construction Systems (MBS) has a long tradition of operating its facilities in the safest possible manner. MBS also believes in being a responsible corporate citizen and maintaining open, constructive dialogue with our neighbors. These principles are an integral part of our corporate vision statement and values. We believe that sharing this information with our neighbors makes good sense. By doing so, we believe the community will better understand how safe and ecologically sound MBS operates.

Policies
Master Builders Solutions Construction Systems has the following Corporate Guidelines related to environmental, health and safety:
1) We produce products that are safe to manufacture, use and dispose.
2) We assist our customers to use our products safely and in an environmentally sound manner. We provide them with information on correct handling of our products.
3) We minimize the impact on mankind and the environment during production, storage, transportation, marketing and use of our products.
4) Economic considerations do not take priority over environmental protection, health and safety.
5) An important contribution to Sustainable Development is our involvement in the Responsible Care initiative worldwide. This applies to our products and services in all our businesses and affiliates.
6) We are committed to making continuous improvements in safety, health, and environmental protection. We do this acting on our own initiative and in consultation with recognized regulatory authorities. We take any action judged to be necessary, whether dictated by statutory obligation or official regulations.
7) We encourage safety, environmental and health awareness among employees.
8) We regard it as an important corporate duty to advance science and technology to improve safety and environmental protection.
